constellations_other.description: Inspired by Courtney Barnett playing an elevator operator in her hit song of the same name, we look at how they're used on-screen for comedy, drama and suspense, with the small, confined boxes forcing characters to physically confront each other.

links.description: Cinematographer Robert Yeoman incorporated whip pans into Wes Anderson’s The Grand Budapest Hotel. The distinctively Anderson-esque camera move is often used to change from one character to another with a huge 180-degree pan and mimics the mechanism of panoramic slides.

links.description: Complex camera set ups aside, the simple yet effective push-in shot used in Wings achieved a similarly immersive impression, not only giving audiences short vignettes of other characters in the film but drawing them into the dizzying inner world of a drunken Jack Powell.
